thread.title: Snohomish river system and tributaries closed for salmon fishing due to poor coho returns
thread.title_full: Snohomish river system and tributaries closed for salmon fishing due to poor coho returns | The Seattle Times

author: Mark Yuasa
title: Snohomish river system and tributaries closed for salmon fishing due to poor coho returns
text:
Low coho returns have prompted state fishery managers to close salmon fishing until further notice the Snohomish, Skykomish, Snoqualmie, and Wallace rivers.
Rivers could reopen once hatcheries have reached spawning escapement goals.
This includes the Snohomish from the mouth (Burlington Northern Railroad bridges) of the Snohomish River upstream to the confluence of the Skykomish and Snoqualmie rivers; Skykomish from the mouth upstream to the confluence of the North and South Forks; Snoqualmie from the mouth upstream to Snoqualmie Falls; and Wallace from the mouth upstream to 200 feet above the water intake for the salmon hatchery.
